Key Arguments: The individual believes they have the ability to discern truth from lies and should be able to express their views freely.
The legislation is seen as a form of censorship that could suppress differing viewpoints.
The government has previously been wrong in defining misinformation, as illustrated by the handling of Covid-19 vaccine information.
The bill is perceived as a threat to individual rights and freedoms, likening it to dictatorial control.
Notable Quotes: We are not a communist country. We should not be told what to believe and have different points of view censored.
The government will cause harm by silencing Australians!
The government is supposed to represent the people, not set itself up as a dictatorship.
